alert.note: Alert for Southeastern Elko County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 18 at 11:10AM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...Locally strong winds in the West Wendover area this afternoon... A strong cold front will be pushing east into southeastern Elko county, including the city of West Wendover. Strong west to northwest winds of 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 55 mph will be likely today along with some light snow showers. No accumulations are expected. Locally stronger winds of 40 to 45 mph with gusts of 60 to 65 mph will be possible, which will bring hazardous driving conditions for high profile vehicles. In addition, blowing dust will help to limit visibility to less than one-half mile in spots. If driving along I-80, motorists are urged to use caution as rapid reductions to visibility and strong crosswinds will cause difficult driving conditions. The strong winds will last until later this afternoon. Visit www.weather.gov/elko for the latest weather information.
